title: Anti-Trump protesters spread a powerful message on the Statue of Liberty
text:
Anti-Trump protesters spread a powerful message on the Statue of Liberty 0 A new line was added to Emma Lazarus' poem. Image: Daniel Berehulak/Getty Images By Sasha Lekach 2017-02-22 02:30:28 UTC 
A sign unfurled on the Statue of Liberty added to its message about America taking in the "tired" and "poor" and those "yearning to breathe free.‚Äù Its words? ‚ÄúRefugees Welcome.‚Äù 
A small group of activists claimed responsibility for the message and posted about it on the Twitter account Alt Lady Liberty . Patriots unfurled a massive banner at the foot of Lady Liberty.When injustice is being perpetuated, we must all stand up #RefugeesWelcome pic.twitter.com/rz3Qtwzqco 
‚Äî Alt Lady Liberty (@AltStatLiberty) February 21, 2017 
Another tweet had a message for the president, who announced new immigration policies Tuesday after his initial executive order to ban refugees and people from seven Muslim-majority countries was suspended by the court system. The message of the Statue of Liberty is unmistakable. 
‚Äî Alt Lady Liberty (@AltStatLiberty) February 21, 2017 
The small group said in a statement that they "felt like we needed to say something about the America we believe in." ‚ÄúRefugees Welcome‚Äù on Statue of LibertyStatement from people claiming credit: ‚Äúwe needed to say something about the America we believe in‚Äù pic.twitter.com/Rs1JJrtl5s 
‚Äî Bradd Jaffy (@BraddJaffy) February 21, 2017 
A few hours later, the banner was taken down , but not before the #RefugeesWelcome hashtag had spread across the internet, along with support for what many saw as a line to add to "New Colossus," Emma Lazarus' poem found on a plaque inside the monument.
